page.title: 08FARMING IN NORTH AXHOLME.
page.content: Although there is{some light {industry}in the Isle of Axholme, the main feature of this area is its {Agriculture.}This particular block is, in many ways typical of agricultural {North Lincolnshire}(or South Humberside, as the region is presently known), but it does have some unique features of its own. For a start, the land is far {flatter}than land further South. This is due to the fact that the land is reclaimed marshland. Consequently the land is{rich arable land}and mostly given up to a cycle of crops which nowadays includes{oilseed rape.}Of the six farms in this block, only Cottage Farm (owned by Mr Charlie Morgan) raises cattle: a herd of French Cherolet beef cattle. Crops grown also include{wheat, oats, barley, sugar {beat, peas and potatoes.
